question: 二枚舌
sourceMnemonic: You have <kanji>two</kanji> <kanji>flat objects</kanji> that make up your <kanji>tongue</kanji>. What kind of tongue is made up of two of anything? That's a tongue that's split, that's a <vocabulary>forked tongue</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. That's the case for the first two kanji, but <ja>舌</ja> actually uses the kun'yomi. Not only that, it's read here as <ja>じた</ja>, and not <ja>した</ja>.
